|Contributors=Jennifer Cautela

[[File:Ecg typique.jpg|centré|vignette|900x900px|Sus décalage de ST, diffuse, non-systematisé, concave vers le haut, sans miroir ni onde Q ET sous décalage PQ]]

question.question: Which of the following is a characteristic ECG finding in acute pericarditis?
question.option_a: Presence of a Q wave and ST elevation in a specific coronary artery distribution
question.option_b: Diffuse ST elevation that is concave upwards and not confined to a single coronary artery territory
question.option_c: Inverted T waves and prolonged QT interval
question.option_d: Prominent U waves and ST depression
